author: NewsBreak Original
title: 1-in-30-million orange lobster found at Red Lobster in Colorado
text:
By Jack Aylmer ,
2 hours ago
Employees at a Red Lobster restaurant in Pueblo, Colorado, made a rare find after an orange lobster was accidentally delivered to the restaurant. The restaurant's manager and customers noticed how much the lobster stuck out among the other darker colored crustaceans in the restaurant's tank and made sure it did not become a customer's meal.
The restaurant ultimately called Denver's Downtown Aquarium , and aquarium staff transported the lobster to Denver on Wednesday, July 17. Aquarium officials said that they named the lobster "Crush" in honor of the Denver Broncos' famous "Orange Crush" defense that dominated in the 1970s and 1980s.
The food vendor who delivered Crush to the Pueblo Red Lobster said that the lobster was captured off of the coast of Canada.
Aquarium officials said that Crush's color comes from "a genetic mutation, which affects encoded proteins. The lack of one or several proteins can reveal itself in colors, including blue, yellow and orange."
The genetic mutation is extremely rare, occurring in just one in every 30 million lobsters, according to the Downtown Aquarium .
However, this is not the first time an orange lobster nearly ended up on someone's seafood platter. In 2018, a Massachusetts grocery store discovered it had an orange lobster in its tank. The store also sent that lobster to a local aquarium.
The post 1-in-30-million orange lobster found at Red Lobster in Colorado appeared first on Straight Arrow News .
Expand All Read in NewsBreak

title: AstrÃ³nomos alertan sobre contaminaciÃ³n lumÃ­nica por proyecto energÃ©tico cerca de telescopios en Chile
text:
AstrÃ³nomos alertan sobre contaminaciÃ³n lumÃ­nica por proyecto energÃ©tico cerca de telescopios en Chile
El Observatorio Europeo Austral (ESO) alertÃ³ el jueves sobre la amenaza que podrÃ­a significar para el funcionamiento del observatorio Paranal, en el norte de Chile, la construcciÃ³n de un proyecto para desarrollar hidrÃ³geno y amoniaco verde, debido a la contaminaciÃ³n lumÃ­nica.
Los cientÃ­ficos levantaron las alarmas frente al inicio de la tramitaciÃ³n ambiental de un "megaproyecto" para producir hidrÃ³geno y amoniaco verde por parte de la empresa chilena AES Andes.
[
Lee TambiÃ©n
](/noticia/nacional/zoologico-metropolitano-fue-evacuado-cerrado-chimpance-intento-escapar-9-1-2025)
ZoolÃ³gico Metropolitano fue evacuado y cerrado: chimpancÃ© intentÃ³ escapar del recinto
El proyecto se emplazarÃ­a en Taltal, regiÃ³n de Antofagasta, a entre cinco y 11 km de distancia de Paranal, que alberga al Very Large Telescope, uno de los instrumentos Ã³pticos mÃ¡s poderosos del mundo. Junto a Ã©l, se construye el Extremely Large Telescope, con aÃºn mayor capacidad.
"Las emisiones de polvo durante la construcciÃ³n, el aumento de la turbulencia atmosfÃ©rica y, especialmente la contaminaciÃ³n lumÃ­nica, tendrÃ¡n un impacto irreparable en las capacidades de observaciÃ³n astronÃ³mica", advirtiÃ³ el director general de ESO, Xavier Barcons, en un comunicado.
Paranal fue inaugurado en 1999 y se ubica en pleno desierto de Atacama, el mÃ¡s Ã¡rido del mundo, un lugar ideal para la observaciÃ³n astronÃ³mica por su clima seco, altitud y ausencia de nubes y lluvia.
El complejo es parte de la red de observatorios astronÃ³micos con los que cuenta Chile, entre ellos el radiotelescopio Alma y el telescopio Ã³ptico de La Silla, tambiÃ©n en el norte de Chile.
A fines de diciembre, la compaÃ±Ã­a AES Andes informÃ³ que el proyecto incluye "la producciÃ³n de hidrÃ³geno y amoniaco verde, asÃ­ como el desarrollo de energÃ­a solar, eÃ³lica y de almacenamiento en baterÃ­as", en lÃ­nea con el objetivo de Chile de ampliar el origen renovable de su matriz energÃ©tica.
AES Andes no emitiÃ³ comentarios ante una peticiÃ³n de la AFP.
Para Itziar de Gregorio, representante de ESO en Chile, "es crucial considerar ubicaciones alternativas para este megaproyecto que no pongan en peligro uno de los tesoros astronÃ³micos mÃ¡s importantes del mundo".
En octubre de 2024, comenzÃ³ a regir en Chile una nueva norma lumÃ­nica para resguardar lugares cercanos a los observatorios, pero tambiÃ©n la salud de personas y animales.
La normativa establece lÃ­mites de luminosidad, horarios mÃ¡ximos de funcionamiento de pantallas publicitarias, ademÃ¡s de promover la transiciÃ³n hacia el uso de luz cÃ¡lida, menos contaminante.
[SÃ­guenos en](https://news.google.com/publications/CAAiEOgjh55R1O_OHSPw0T00iXYqFAgKIhDoI4eeUdTvzh0j8NE9NIl2)

author: Clayton McChesney
title: Cat with broken spine learns to walk again: â€˜He wanted to surviveâ€™
text: BLUEFIELD, W. Va. ( WVVA /Gray News) - The lives of stray cats donâ€™t always have happy endings, but the survival of one lucky cat in West Virginia is helping to show how love and affection can beat even unlikely odds. Second Chance for Cats is not a stranger to rescuing strays. The shelter houses many felines waiting for their forever homes. It recently took in an injured stray named Sapphire and found out that what first appeared to be a broken leg was actually a broken neck. Elizabeth MacDonald, the co-founder and treasurer of Second Chance for Cats, said it was the first time the shelter had seen that sort of injury. â€œWeâ€™ve had some broken legs before, weâ€™ve had broken tails, but we have never had anything thatâ€™s been this severe,â€ she said. Sapphire had fractured his C7 vertebra, leaving him almost unable to move. He had to be hand-fed, couldnâ€™t use the litter box, and had to be moved often to prevent bedsores. Second Chance for Cats reached out to veterinarians for help but were told that Sapphireâ€™s survival was unlikely. Dr. Mark French, a veterinarian with Ridge Animal Hospital , said he told MacDonald that the chance of Sapphire regaining his functionality was â€œalmost zero.â€ â€œI think I used the term â€˜might be miraculousâ€™ if it could ever walk again,â€ he said. French said it was unusual for surgery attempts to be made on animals with broken necks. Sapphire was also just four months old, meaning his soft and small bones would require extra care. Despite the setback, MacDonald believed it was not the size of the cat in the fight but the size of the fight in the cat and did what she could to help Sapphire recover. â€œFrom the very first day that we got this cat, there was just something in that catâ€™s eyes. And it was like he wanted to survive,â€ she said. She spoke with her co-worker, and the two agreed that they would do everything in their power to help Sapphire survive. â€œAnd thatâ€™s what we did,â€ McDonald said. French was able to install a plate on Sapphireâ€™s small spine through incisions in the top and bottom of his neck. If the surgery was successful, French estimated the cat would be able to walk within four months. However, under the watchful eye of his surgeon and rescuers, Sapphire was wobbly walking in three weeks. â€œElizabeth and her group, I think that they have put in a whole lot of work and they certainly are, what do they call themselves, Second Chance? Well, by golly, thatâ€™s what theyâ€™re into, giving cats a second chance,â€ French said. French said Sapphire changed his outlook on what is possible. MacDonald said she hopes the catâ€™s success story will inspire others going through difficult times to keep their head up and keep fighting. MacDonald also wanted to give credit to the people who donated the $5,000 to make the surgery possible. She said Sapphire will stay at Second Chance for Cats while he heals, but plans to have him up for adoption when he is ready. Copyright 2024 WVVA via Gray Media Group, Inc. All rights reserved.

author: @gurufocus
title: Insmed Inc (INSM) Announces Positive Phase 3 Results for Brensocatib in Bronchiectasis | INSM ...
text:
Summary
On April 23, 2025, Insmed Inc (INSM, Financial), a global biopharmaceutical company, announced the publication of positive results from its pivotal phase 3 ASPEN study in the New England Journal of Medicine. The study evaluated brensocatib, an investigational therapy for non-cystic fibrosis bronchiectasis, demonstrating a statistically significant reduction in pulmonary exacerbations and lung function decline. Brensocatib is currently under priority review by the U.S. Food and Drug Administration, with a target action date set for August 12, 2025.
Positive Aspects
- Brensocatib showed a statistically significant reduction in the frequency of pulmonary exacerbations compared to placebo.
- The study demonstrated a significant reduction in the rate of lung function decline with brensocatib 25 mg.
- Brensocatib was well-tolerated, with manageable treatment-emergent adverse events.
- The ASPEN study is the largest clinical trial ever conducted in bronchiectasis, highlighting its robust data set.
Negative Aspects
- Brensocatib is still under investigation and has not yet received regulatory approval.
- Potential adverse events, such as COVID-19, nasopharyngitis, cough, and headache, were noted in the study.
Financial Analyst Perspective
From a financial standpoint, the positive results from the ASPEN study could significantly enhance Insmed Inc's market position, especially if brensocatib receives FDA approval. The potential approval could open up a new revenue stream in the bronchiectasis market, which currently lacks approved therapies. However, investors should remain cautious of the risks associated with regulatory approval processes and market acceptance.
Market Research Analyst Perspective
The ASPEN study's results position brensocatib as a potential first-in-class therapy for bronchiectasis, addressing a significant unmet medical need. With approximately 1.25 million patients diagnosed in the U.S., EU5, and Japan, the market potential is substantial. The successful commercialization of brensocatib could transform the treatment landscape for bronchiectasis and potentially expand into other neutrophil-mediated inflammatory diseases.
Frequently Asked Questions
Q: What is the significance of the ASPEN study?
A: The ASPEN study is the largest clinical trial conducted in bronchiectasis, demonstrating significant reductions in pulmonary exacerbations and lung function decline with brensocatib.
Q: What is the current status of brensocatib?
A: Brensocatib is under priority review by the U.S. FDA, with a target action date of August 12, 2025.
Q: What are the potential side effects of brensocatib?
A: Common treatment-emergent adverse events include COVID-19, nasopharyngitis, cough, and headache.
Q: How does brensocatib work?
A: Brensocatib is a dipeptidyl peptidase 1 (DPP1) inhibitor that targets neutrophil-mediated inflammation, potentially reducing lung damage and inflammation.
 Read the original press release here.

Our objective is to deliver long-term, fundamental data-driven analysis. Be aware that our analysis might not incorporate the most recent, price-sensitive company announcements or qualitative information. GuruFocus holds no position in the stocks mentioned herein.

author: Ed Wittenberg, special to cleveland.com
title: Solon resident explains why he posted petition against Chagrin Valley Islamic Center - cleveland.com
text: Mark Liner, a Solon resident who is serving as a member of the Israel Defense Forces, says the amount of anti-Israel rhetoric that has been spread since Oct. 7, 2023 -- when Hamas launched a surprise attack on Israel -- is â€œterrifying.â€ In an online interview Wednesday (Oct. 23), Liner said that was one of the reasons why he and a group of other residents posted a petition in late September on change.org against the Solon-based Chagrin Valley Islamic Center (CVIC). The petition, signed by â€œWe the People of Solon,â€ demands that city leaders â€œcondemn the antisemitism being openly harbored and promotedâ€ by the CVIC and to have the CVIC cease operations in the city. Liner said the CVIC -- which opened the cityâ€™s first mosque on Liberty Road in 2021 -- has been promoting antisemitism â€œunder the guise of anti-Zionismâ€ for more than three years, despite vocal concerns from the community. â€œI made this petition along with over a dozen Solon residents who are also concerned about the recent rise in antisemitism,â€ said Liner, a 2019 Solon High School graduate who requested that his city of residence in Israel not be disclosed. â€œOur only goal is to call out antisemitism and make sure that our city leaders follow through with upholding the cityâ€™s DEI (diversity, equity and inclusion) policies and antisemitism resolution (passed in April 2023).â€ Liner said the petition was signed by â€œa few Muslim people, who acknowledge that the hate against Israel being promoted by the (CVIC) has nothing to do with the Quran and goes against true Islam.â€ Liner claimed that after Oct. 7, 2023, the CVIC and its leaders started to heavily promote antisemitism and radicalism. â€œItâ€™s a fact that this became a regular pattern with the CVIC, despite reaching out to both city leaders and the mosque itself, that I and other Solon residents felt the need to make the petition,â€ he said. CVIC officials deny these claims and said that their mosque has promoted peace throughout the conflict between Hamas and Israel. At the City Council meeting Monday (Oct. 21), 19 people -- including many religious leaders -- spoke to council in support of the CVIC. After nearly 200 people signed the petition, it was removed from change.org after being â€œmass reported,â€ Liner said. â€œThe website claimed it was removed due to â€˜false or misleading information,â€™ despite not stating what information specifically they considered to be false or misleading,â€ he said. Liner was also a co-organizer of a pro-Israel rally Sept. 8 in Solon. More than 100 people rallied that day at the cityâ€™s Veterans Memorial Park gazebo to commemorate the 11-month mark since Hamas launched its attack on Israel. More than 1,200 people were killed by Hamas in the attack, which triggered the Israel-Hamas War that is still taking place. â€œItâ€™s important to note that this petition has absolutely nothing to do with Islam or the fact that (CVIC is) a mosque, as they may claim that any of their critics are â€˜Islamophobicâ€™ as a way of deflecting attention away from their antisemitism,â€ the petition stated. â€œWe the People of Solon stand with the Global Imams Council and their statement that was released on Sept. 1, 2024, blaming Hamas for all deaths and destruction on both sides since Oct. 7, (2023), naming Hamas as the aggressor in the war, and calling for the immediate release of all hostages who were kidnapped by Hamas. â€œWe wish that the Chagrin Valley Islamic Center would follow the wisdom of the Global Imams Council and stop promoting and partnering with organizations and ideologies that front as being Islamic community organizations, but in reality act as an arm for Hamas and Islamic Jihad in the West.â€ The petition also stated that the CVIC has partnered with and is in support of the Council on American-Islamic Relations (CAIR), a Muslim civil rights and advocacy group based in Washington, D.C. Liner claimed that CAIR â€œpromotes its members to attend anti-Israel rallies and take part in antisemitic activities.â€ â€œThe Biden administration cut ties with CAIR last December after its national executive director, Nihad Awad, stated at a CAIR conference that Oct. 7 attacks made him â€˜happy,â€™â€ Liner said. Allegations date to 2021 Liner noted that he runs a group on Facebook called the Solon Community Group. In 2021, he said it was brought to his attention that the CVIC was promoting antisemitism with the invitation of a â€œnotorious antisemiteâ€ named Yasir Qadhi as the featured speaker for one of its first fundraisers. â€œQadhi is listed by the Canary Mission as having a long history of promoting antisemitism and hate against Christians, hate against Israel and supporting terrorists,â€ Liner said. â€œAfter speaking with a few other residents, I sent Solon Mayor Ed Kraus an email of concern regarding the mosque promoting this speaker. â€œHe replied, thanking me for bringing this to his attention, and later spoke with the CVICâ€™s leaders to have them cancel Qadhi from their event.â€ Less than a month later, Liner claimed, CVIC leaders Simee and Masroor Malik started sharing â€œanti-Israel ideologiesâ€ on their joint Facebook account, including promoting a â€œFree Palestineâ€ protest in downtown Cleveland. â€œI continued to bring these issues up with Mayor Kraus because the concern was that this new religious institution was suddenly promoting radicalism and hate against Israel,â€ Liner said. â€œAlso, Masroor Malik, the leader of the mosque, is an unelected member of the Solon Community Relations Committee through City Hall and is listed on the cityâ€™s website (as such).â€ Masroor Malik is the CVICâ€™s director of finance and a member of its executive board. A more recent example of the CVICâ€™s promotion of radicalism and antisemitism, Liner said, is its promotion of an event set for Saturday (Oct. 26) at Case Western Reserve University in Cleveland featuring former CNN anchor Marc Lamont Hill, who was fired from his position at CNN in 2018 after his antisemitic and pro-terrorist comments surfaced. â€œKeep in mind Marc Lamont Hill has nothing to do with Islam or the teachings of the Quran; rather his only involvement in Middle East issues is with his open support of jihadism and hatred of Israel,â€ Liner said. â€œItâ€™s very concerning to people that the CVIC is promoting him.â€ Liner said since posting the petition, he has been â€œharassed and targetedâ€ by CAIR, the Party for Socialism and Liberation, and â€œa few radical faith leaders in the area because Iâ€™m a lone soldier in the IDF.â€ A â€œlone soldierâ€ is a soldier in the IDF with no family in Israel to support him or her. â€œTheyâ€™re using the fact that Iâ€™m an IDF soldier as a way to stir hate about this petition, combined with the lie that it was â€˜Islamophobic,â€™â€ Liner said. â€Itâ€™s a completely irrelevant detail to the petition, and not only that, but the petition was made along with over a dozen Solon residents who are Jews, Christians and Hindus.â€ When asked for his reaction to the comments made by speakers in support of the CVIC at Mondayâ€™s council meeting, Liner said, â€œMost of the people who spoke gave nothing but the same repetitive emotional arguments over and over again about how the CVIC donates to food drives and has samosa dinner parties at their mosque. â€œBut in my opinion and the opinion of many other Solon residents, none of that justifies the mosque promoting radicalism and antisemitism,â€ he said. Read more from the Chagrin Solon Sun .

author: Ireland's premier breaking news app
title: Blustery end to the year with alerts north and south
text: Stormy conditions will continue through to the end of the year as a series of weather warnings have been issued for the coming days. Heavy rainfall in the northwest on Friday may lead to localised flooding, Met Ã‰ireann warned, placing Donegal, Leitrim, North Mayo and Sligo under a yellow alert until 9pm on Friday. The warnings will spread on Saturday, impacting counties north and south of the Border. Overnight and throughout Saturday, strong and gusty southwesterly winds will batter western and southern coastal counties, bringing heavy rain and thundery showers. âš ï¸Yellow Rainfall Warningâš ï¸ Donegal, Leitrim, North Mayo, Sligo Heavy rainfall leading to localised floodingðŸŒ§ï¸ðŸŒŠ Valid: 06:00 Friday 29/12/2023 to 21:00 Friday 29/12/2023 Keep updated on warnings & valid times in your area from now & over the weekendâ¬‡ï¸ [https://t.co/ZsjQsKDvt6] [pic.twitter.com/FwdtzDBlxS] â€” Met Ã‰ireann (@MetEireann) [December 29, 2023] A yellow alert for wind and rain will cover Mayo, Galway, Clare, Limerick, Kerry, Cork, Waterford, and Wexford from 2am to 11pm on Saturday. A rain warning for Northern Ireland will also take effect overnight, lasting from 4am to 11am, with the UK Met Office warning the conditions may cause some transport disruptions. The bad weather will subside somewhat on New Year's Eve, but windy conditions are expected to continue in Clare, Limerick, Kerry and Cork. The four Munster counties will again be covered by a yellow warning for wind from 11pm on Saturday to 5pm on Sunday.

title: Pedro SuÃ¡rez-VÃ©rtiz falleciÃ³: Â¿dÃ³nde serÃ¡ el velorio del Ã­cono del rock peruano? | FarÃ¡ndula | La RepÃºblica
text: Pedro SuÃ¡rez-VÃ©rtiz falleciÃ³: Â¿dÃ³nde serÃ¡ el velorio del Ã­cono del rock peruano? [Pedro SuÃ¡rez-VÃ©rtiz falleciÃ³ a los 54 aÃ±os](https://larepublica.pe/espectaculos/farandula/2023/12/28/pedro-suarez-vertiz-murio-a-los-54-anos-2494716) [FalleciÃ³ Pedro SuÃ¡rez - VÃ©rtiz HOY a los 54 aÃ±os: Ãºltimas noticias sobre su deceso](https://larepublica.pe/espectaculos/farandula/2023/12/28/pedro-suarez-vertiz-fallecio-ultimas-noticias-de-la-muerte-del-cantante-enfermedad-biografia-arena-hash-315784) [Giacomo Bocchio se defiende por practicar la cacerÃ­a: â€œMe atacan, pero luego comen pollo a la brasaâ€](https://larepublica.pe/espectaculos/farandula/2023/12/25/giacomo-bocchio-se-defiende-por-practicar-la-caceria-me-atacan-pero-luego-comen-pollo-a-la-brasa-el-gran-chef-famosos-1521600) Pedro SuÃ¡rez-VÃ©rtiz, [ cantante peruano](https://larepublica.pe/espectaculos/2023/12/28/asi-fue-la-ultima-entrevista-que-pedro-suarez-vertiz-dio-a-la-prensa-peruana-antes-de-su-muerte-psv-murio-atmp-2584568), falleciÃ³ este Ãºltimo 28 de diciembre y sus fans lamentan la noticia. Como se recuerda, [el artista de 54 aÃ±os](https://larepublica.pe/espectaculos/farandula/2023/01/06/pedro-suarez-vertiz-quien-es-su-hijo-salvador-y-a-que-se-dedica-en-la-actualidad-hijos-de-pedro-suarez-vertiz-evat) padecÃ­a de disartria, una parÃ¡lisis bulbar que le impedÃ­a hablar y moverse de manera habitual. Tras conocerse del deceso del exvocalista de Arena Hash, muchos seguidores querÃ­an saber si es que podrÃ¡n tener la oportunidad de despedirse de su Ã­dolo. Ahora, ya se conoce dÃ³nde serÃ¡ el velorio del intÃ©rprete de 'Cuando pienses en volver'. Â¿DÃ³nde serÃ¡ velado Pedro SuÃ¡rez-VÃ©rtiz? La maÃ±ana de este viernes 29 de diciembre, Cynthia MartÃ­nez, [esposa de Pedro SuÃ¡rez VÃ©rtiz](https://larepublica.pe/espectaculos/farandula/2023/12/28/pedro-suarezvertiz-esposa-de-cantante-peruano-viajara-desde-espana-para-darle-el-ultimo-adios-736932), volviÃ³ a Lima para despedirse de su cÃ³nyuge. Ella se encontraba en EspaÃ±a con sus hijos y, tras la lamentable noticia, tuvo que retornar lo antes posible. Una vez en suelo peruano, la madre de los hijos del cantante continuÃ³ con las exequias. Es asÃ­ que, al departamento en el que vivÃ­a el intÃ©rprete, en Miraflores, llegÃ³ una carroza fÃºnebre en la que minutos despuÃ©s fue trasladado el ataÃºd del hermano de Patricio SuÃ¡rez-VÃ©rtiz. Este vehÃ­culo arribÃ³ a las instalaciones del velatorio de la iglesia Virgen de FÃ¡tima, en el mismo distrito. Cabe recalcar que, hasta el cierre de esta nota, la familia no ha confirmado si el pÃºblico podrÃ¡ darle el Ãºltimo adiÃ³s al mÃºsico o si continuarÃ¡n con las actividades en privado. PUEDES VER: [Peruanos en EspaÃ±a recuerdan â€˜Cuando pienses en volverâ€™ de PSV: â€œEs un himno para los migrantesâ€] Â¿Pedro SuÃ¡rez-VÃ©rtiz serÃ¡ velado en el Ministerio de Cultura? El Ministerio de Cultura expresÃ³ su pesar por la muerte del cantante [Pedro SuÃ¡rez-VÃ©rtiz](https://larepublica.pe/espectaculos/farandula/2023/12/28/jaime-bayly-se-quiebra-al-hablar-de-pedro-suarezvertiz-como-si-hubiera-muerto-un-hermano-para-mi-844732), quien dejÃ³ de existir este Ãºltimo jueves 28 de diciembre. En un pronunciamiento en redes sociales, esta entidad del Estado recordÃ³ la trayectoria del exintegrante y fundador de Arena Hash. Mensaje del Ministerio de Cultura. Foto: captura de X "Nos hemos puesto en contacto con su familia para poner a disposiciÃ³n las instalaciones de nuestra sede central para sus exequias", se lee en el texto en X, antes Twitter. Licenciado en Ciencias de la ComunicaciÃ³n de la Universidad CÃ©sar Vallejo (UCV). Redactor web de espectÃ¡culos en La RepÃºblica. Tengo interÃ©s por las pelÃ­culas, series de Marvel, formatos de entretenimiento y talento en televisiÃ³n. Me gustan los animales y salgo a manejar bicicleta cada vez que puedo. Cargando MgId...
